title: Remove bottom margin below tab bars on Home, Pond, Tag, and TagHub pages

requirements.summary: Remove page-specific bottom margin spacing below tab bars on HomePage, PondPage, TagPage, and TagHubPage without affecting tab spacing elsewhere.
acceptanceCriteria: HomePage: the Tabs container no longer applies bottom-margin utility classes (e.g., remove `mb-0 lg:mb-4` from the Tabs `className`).
PondPage: the Tabs container no longer applies bottom-margin utility classes (e.g., remove `mb-0 lg:mb-4` from the Tabs `className`).
TagPage: the Tabs container no longer applies bottom-margin utility classes (e.g., remove `mb-4` from the Tabs `className`).

TagHubPage: the tabs header wrapper no longer adds bottom margin below the tab buttons (e.g., remove `mb-4` from the `border-b ...` wrapper inside Tabs) so the content card starts immediately below the tab bar.
No other pages/components have their tab spacing changed.

file_operations.description: Remove the bottom-margin utility classes from the HomePage Tabs container so the main content card sits directly under the tab bar.
Remove the bottom-margin utility classes from the PondPage Tabs container so the pond feed card sits directly under the tab bar.
Remove the bottom-margin utility class from the TagPage Tabs container so the tag results card sits directly under the tab bar.

Remove the bottom-margin utility class from the TagHubPage tab header wrapper (the `border-b ...` wrapper inside Tabs) to eliminate the gap before the tag list card, without changing tab spacing in other pages.
